poem.content:
A comic book of days, a life in every segment,
The space between heartbeats, a pregnant, silent hum.
We live a painted state, a canvas oil slicked and grim,
Each gesture, a chosen style, a shattered atom come undone.

The entry to forever, guarded by a painted liar,
His words like weighted march, a crushing, heavy ball.
The author of my sorrow, writes a fate I can't deny,
Leaving me to listen, as the empty echoes call.

Beneath the surface gleam, a deeper darkness waits,
Imprisoned in this type of story, sealed in frozen time.
I search for a release, for solace through the gates,
But the liar's clever script, becomes tragically sublime.

The painted ball of promise, turns to crashing, cold despair,
Another comic segment folds, in March's frigid care.
The story ends abruptly, a silent, stifled breath,
A frozen, hollow lie, a poetâ€™s lonely death.
